title: TYSON vs GIVENS t-shirt FONT ID
content:
looking for a font ID on the type used for TYSON specifically. many thanks in advance,  
danny

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090330043818im_/http:/typophile.com/cms/files/TYSON_4617.jpg)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [TYSON.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20090330043818/http:/typophile.com/cms/files/TYSON.jpg) | 36.45 KB |

 [‹ "Rest of her life" Cover font](http://web.archive.org/web/20090330043818/http:/typophile.com/cms/node/56320 "Go to previous forum topic") [Type ID - Please... ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20090330043818/http:/typophile.com/cms/node/56332 "Go to next forum topic")
author: SKUMATIK

comments.content: I ran the image through TypeDNA’s font recognition software (FontEdge) and the “Givens” is matching as: Centennial LT 75.
Depends how much the G is distorted. Didot came out as the second match.

The serif is a Didot for sure. For the sans: I assume I’m overlooking something obvious. It’s neither Alpin Gothic nor Alternate Gothic, no condensed style of AG, Helvetica, Univers etc. Some more characteristic letters would help. Closest I found is [Titling Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20090330043818/http:/fontbureau.com/fonts/sans/TitlingGothicFB/styles).  
F
